isis.stitle: TSI 01-12-04 - Engine Knock at Low Idle with Split-Shot Injectors

subjectgroup.subject: Engine Knock at Low Idle with Split-Shot Injectors

geninfo.para: International® T 444E engines (serial numbers 460195 - Up) using split-shot fuel injectors may develop an engine knock at low idle. (The engine knock is usually a fuel knock that can be mistaken for connecting rod knock.) The fuel knock can be intermittent and increase in intensity as the engine warms up to operating temperature. The fuel knock will not damage the engine, decrease engine performance, or affect fuel economy.

important.para: Read this service bulletin completely. Determine conditions (1 or 2 below) before repairing the engine.

para.emph: 1. Fuel knock with no decrease in engine performance

item.para: Verify fuel pressure. See : Identify Fuel Pressure Regulator.
If fuel knock remains after fuel pressure verification, see : Long Lead Injector Installation.
Verify fuel pressure. See : Identify Fuel Pressure Regulator.

If the fuel knock remains after doing Additional Fuel Pressure Diagnostics,
call Tech Services for help.

para.emph: 2. Fuel knock, low power, misfire, and sometimes excessive white smoke

item.para: Verify fuel pressure. See : Identify Fuel Pressure Regulator.

If fuel knock, low power, or engine misfire remains after doing Additional Fuel Pressure Diagnostics,
do a Key On Engine Running Injector Test to diagnose fuel injectors and power cylinders. Correct all problems. (See CTS-5297: 1998 Engine Service Tips, pages 25 - 32 or Engine/Vehicle Diagnostics Manual EGES-190: Performance Diagnostics, Section 2.3, page 20.

step1.para: Install Kit 1830915C91 to upgrade regulator to 72 psi.
Verify fuel pressure (65 - 75 psi at low idle) at fuel pressure valve.

If fuel pressure is still low,
Causes of Low fuel pressure.

note.para: If fuel knock, low power, misfire, and sometimes excessive white smoke remain after fuel pressure is verified, do Additional Fuel Pressure Diagnostics. .

step1.para: Verify fuel pressure (65 - 75 psi) at low idle.
If pressure is low, disassemble regulator and inspect regulator for debris, scoring, and damage.
Replace or reassemble regulator and retest.

If pressure is still low, see
Causes of Low Fuel Pressure.

note.para: If fuel knock, low power, misfire, and sometimes excessive white smoke remain after fuel pressure is verified, do Additional Fuel Pressure Diagnostics. .

svcproc.para: To find out the pressure setting for the fuel regulator valve, check the brass outlet fitting.

item.para: A smooth hex fitting was used for fuel regulators set for 47 psi. (Engines serial numbers 460195 - 586277)
A notched hex fitting is used for fuel regulators set for 72 psi. (Engines serial numbers 586278 - Up)

figure.caption: Figure 2. Old and new outlet fittings and regulator Kit 1830915C91

svcproc.para: To upgrade the fuel regulator from 47 psi to 72 psi, install Kit 1830915C91.

note.para: Do not install Kit 1830915C91 in non split-shot systems.

figure.caption: Fuel inlet check valve with and without inlet screen

svcproc.para: Early 1997 Model Year engines used inlet check valves without an inlet screen. (Engine serial numbers 460195 - 626395)
Inlet screen 1826761C2 was added to inlet check valves used on later engines. (Engine serial numbers 626396 - Up)

figure.caption: Figure 5. Plugged ports in right and left cylinder heads

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: If the fuel knock remains after correcting the fuel pressure regulator and completing additional fuel pressure diagnostics, replace the standard fuel injector (in cylinder no. 8) with a long lead fuel injector.

item.para: Long lead injectors are used to correct fuel knock at low idle only.
Long lead injectors are for use in cylinder no. 8 only. (See Figure 8.)
Long lead injectors, having package part numbers 1833647C91 and 1833646C92, are not interchangeable between engine serial number groups listed below.
Engines with serial numbers 1313828 - Up had long lead injectors installed at the assembly plant. If the fuel knock remains, call Tech Services for assistance.
Most long lead injectors have a blue connector to the solenoid. (See Figure 8.)
All long lead injectors are marked LLon the solenoid. (See Figure 8.)

para.emph: NEW LONG LEAD INJECTOR PART NUMBERS
